definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]

sentences.english: Check out this chat set up specifically for discussion of the Iran election and aftermath.
sentences.chinese: 点击这里查看专为伊朗大选及其余波而准备的聊天室。

sentences.english: The images reveal a city still very much coping with the aftermath of the disaster.
sentences.chinese: 图片显示了这座城市仍然承受着严重的灾后余波。

sentences.english: The Iranian response was delayed by the presidential elections in June and their bloody aftermath.
sentences.chinese: 伊朗六月的总统选举以及血腥的余波拖延了其回应。

sentences.english: We’re also seeing the reverberations of this crisis with the rise in foreclosures.
sentences.chinese: 这场危机仍然余波未了，房屋止赎数量还在上升。

sentences.english: Forced relocations, though, could pale next to larger fallouts from the project.
sentences.chinese: 强制拆迁只是这项工程的许多余波之一。

sentences.english: The aftereffect of this movie made me not want to go to bed alone.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影的余波就是让我仍不敢自己上床睡觉。

sentences.english: The aftermath of Cablegate led to the first publicly viewable infowar.
sentences.chinese: 密电门的余波让首次让公众一窥信息战的真面目。

sentences.english: The trouble hasn't ended; there are still repercussions.

definition: in Daoism, astral wind on which immortals may ride/strong wind
storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
to destroy in an explosion/to break (by bombing)
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
